III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative
references to a youth's background or appearance
or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 made threatening and inappropriate comments to Youth A
on 07/17/2025.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed with DCWL Licensing Consultant 2 on
07/24/2025 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. She recalled an incident from the previous week when
she was interacting with Staff 1. Youth A was in an argument with
Staff 1, and she recalled Staff 1 stating “Do you want to fight me?”
and “I’ll come find you and bang on your door,” referring to Youth
A’s eventual discharge and move back to her home. Youth A
confirmed that there were no other youth or staff present when
this occurred. She recalled Staff 1 not being all that upset when
this exchange occurred and explained that she and Staff 1 had
been arguing about Youth A being able to have a comb in her
possession. Youth A reported having no further issues or
concerns with Staff 1 after this incident. She recalled telling the
Licensee Designee about the interaction with Staff 2 and the
Licensee Designee told Youth A that it would be investigated
further.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DCWL Area Manager on 07/31/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She
recalled the incident in question with Youth A. She reported Youth
A being upset because Youth A was unable to have a certain
comb in her possession while at the facility because it was against
facility policy. She recalled Youth A being upset and stating to
Staff 1 she hated being at the facility. Staff 1 denied making any
threatening or inappropriate statements to Youth A. She believed
the interaction was brief and Youth A calmed down on her
own. Staff 1 recalled Youth A’s father arriving at the facility soon
thereafter for a visit with Youth A and were no further issues from
there.
2

Licensee Designee was interviewed with DCWL Area Manager
present on the phone on 08/07/2025 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. Licensee Designee denied Youth
A ever presented concerns to her about verbal interaction with
Staff 1. Licensee Designee believed Youth A told Staff 2 about
these concerns and Staff 2 presented the concerns to the
Licensee Designee. Licensee Designee then asked Youth A about
the concerns, and Youth A reported to her Staff 1 threatened
her. Licensee Designee arranged for Staff 1 to have another staff
with her while Youth A finished out her placement at the facility.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 2 on 08/25/2025 and
08/27/2025 and no return contact was made.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage from 07/17/2025 was provided
and reviewed. At no point during this footage did it show
Youth A interacting with Staff 1. At 3:00:23 pm Youth A
was seen looking out the front window of the facility and
then sitting on the couch. At 3:23:46 pm Staff 1 was seen
letting Youth A’s father into the facility, and he and Youth A
moved to the front entrance area. Youth A’s father was
signing in the visitor logbook as Youth A stood next to him
and stated, “I cannot wait to get out of here” and then
walked away. At 3:26:43 Youth A exited the facility with her
father and could be heard stating “I’m irritated, I wanted my
hair braided.”
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility Incident Report documentation dated 07/17/2025
and authored by Staff 1 was provided and reviewed. This
document described Youth A preparing herself to go on a
visit with her father. Youth A asked Staff 1 about a comb
and Staff 1 confirmed that she had thrown it away because
of sanitation concerns. Youth A became upset at this. Staff
1 told Youth A the facility could replace the comb and
Youth A declined this offer. Youth A escalated verbally,
swearing at Staff 1. Staff 1 documented she used proper
verbal de-escalation with Youth A. Youth A then sat on the
couch and waited for her father to arrive, and she then
when on an offsite visit with her father.
• Facility policy titled “Interventions/Discipline” last revised in
August 2025 was reviewed. This policy prohibited staff
from certain behaviors towards youth, including “use of
verbal abuse, ridicule, humiliation, or threat.”
3

• Personnel documentation was provided for Staff 1, and she
had no records of discipline. She was last trained in the
facility’s behavior management policy on 07/14/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence
found that Staff 1 made derogatory or threatening comments to
Youth A.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was provided regarding the personal
possessions of youth. If an item is brought into the facility and it
presents hygiene or cleanliness concerns, more care should be
taken in how to handle that item other than disposing of it without
other communication or options explored.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the
Description direct supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable
interval, eye-on checks of residents. The time between the
variable interval checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not make proper eyes on checks of Youth A while
sleeping.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed with DCWL Licensing Consultant 2 on
07/24/2025 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. She recalled sleeping with the door open, and she
believed a staff member would have to check on her overnight but
did not present any concerns related to this.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 2 on 08/25/2025 and
08/27/2025 and no return contact was made.
Documentation reviewed:
• Third shift from 07/11/2025 through 07/24/2025 were
reviewed during the investigations. On 07/11/2025,
07/12/2025, 07/21/2025, 07/22/2025, 07/23/2025 and
07/24/2025 during Youth A’s placement there were
numerous points over the nighttime when staff members,
including Staff 2, documented making eyes on checks of
Youth A in intervals greater than fifteen minutes.
• Facility policy titled “Care & Safety” last updated in August
of 2024 was reviewed. Procedures for staff working
4

overnight shifts required “variable youth checks every
varying 15 minutes per bed check not exceeding 15
minutes.”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed. Evidence was found that
staff members were not making eyes on checks of Youth A as
required by the rule.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
